claim: Amy Cuddy's power poses experiments establish the fundamental principle that individuals feel more powerful when they stand in a pose associated with power.

supporting.text: Amy Cuddy's research demonstrated that adopting expansive, high-power poses for two minutes led to increased feelings of power and confidence in participants.

attacks.text: Amy Cuddy's research demonstrated that adopting expansive, high-power poses for two minutes led to increased feelings of power and confidence in participants.
